attributes.action: Change the two year rule for Mortgage Support Interrest
attributes.additional_details:
It is clear to see there are no jobs out there for hardworking people and the two year rule for S.M.I is far from fair for low interrest owners.
The Right to Buy scheme should be abolished and more help set up for those struggling with their mortgage.
£65 a week you pay on housing benefit is a whole lot cheaper than the £100's you pay in housing benefit to landlords and other housing.
If applicants can show evidence that they are unable to get work housing benefit should remain.
Most already pay the shortful out of their benefit to save their homes.
The buy back scheme is not fair. Why should people give up their homes, the homes they worked hard to get and work long hours to keep and due to the economy they loose their jobs then their home after £65.
We hear all the time that first time buyers cant buy their homes,yet you are willing to let people give up those homes for the sake of £65 a week.
Stop the buy back scheme and help those in hardship
